title: ASAS Criteria for Peripheral SpondyloArthritis (SpA)
description: Classifies peripheral spondyloarthritis according to the Assessment of SpondyloArthritis International Society (ASAS) criteria

parameters.name: peripheral_arthritis
parameters.description: Peripheral arthritis (usually predominantly lower limbs and/or asymmetric arthritis)

parameters.name: psoriasis
parameters.description: Past or present psoriasis diagnosed by a doctor

parameters.name: inflammatory_bowel_disease
parameters.description: Past or present Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis diagnosed by a doctor

parameters.name: preceding_infection
parameters.description: Preceding infection (urethritis/cervicitis or diarrhea within 1 month before arthritis onset)

parameters.name: hla_b27
parameters.description: HLA-B27 positive testing according to standard laboratory techniques

parameters.name: uveitis_anterior
parameters.description: Past or present anterior uveitis confirmed by an ophthalmologist

parameters.name: sacroiliitis_imaging
parameters.description: Sacroiliitis on imaging (bilateral grade 2-4 or unilateral grade 3-4 on X-rays OR active sacroiliitis on MRI)

parameters.name: inflammatory_back_pain_past
parameters.description: History of inflammatory back pain in the past

parameters.name: family_history_spa
parameters.description: Family history of spondyloarthritis (presence in first or second-degree relatives of ankylosing spondylitis, psoriasis, uveitis, reactive arthritis, or inflammatory bowel disease)

ranges.description: Meets ASAS criteria for peripheral spondyloarthritis
ranges.interpretation: Patient meets the ASAS classification criteria for peripheral spondyloarthritis. Entry criterion (arthritis and/or enthesitis and/or dactylitis) is fulfilled plus one or more SpA features from Group A OR two or more SpA features from Group B.

ranges.description: Does not meet ASAS criteria for peripheral spondyloarthritis
ranges.interpretation: Patient does not meet the ASAS classification criteria for peripheral spondyloarthritis. Either the entry criterion is not fulfilled or insufficient SpA features are present.

references: Rudwaleit M, van der Heijde D, Landew√© R, et al. The Assessment of SpondyloArthritis International Society classification criteria for peripheral spondyloarthritis and for spondyloarthritis in general. Ann Rheum Dis. 2011;70(1):25-31.
Sieper J, Rudwaleit M, Baraliakos X, et al. The Assessment of SpondyloArthritis international Society (ASAS) handbook: a guide to assess spondyloarthritis. Ann Rheum Dis. 2009;68 Suppl 2:ii1-44.
formula: Entry criterion: Arthritis and/or enthesitis and/or dactylitis. Plus one or more from Group A (psoriasis, IBD, preceding infection, HLA-B27, uveitis, sacroiliitis) OR two or more from Group B (arthritis, enthesitis, dactylitis, IBP past, family history SpA)
notes: These criteria are intended for classification purposes in research studies
Peripheral arthritis is usually predominantly lower limbs and/or asymmetric arthritis
Enthesitis and dactylitis should be clinically assessed
Sacroiliitis on imaging refers to definite radiographic sacroiliitis or active sacroiliitis on MRI
Classification criteria should not be used as diagnostic criteria in clinical practice
